JUDGES: André Potocki;Angelika Nußberger;Ann Power-Forde;Dean Spielmann;Elisabet Fura;Ganna Yudkivska
TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national who was born on DATE .

The applicant entered GPE on CARDINAL DATE and applied for asylum DATE . She stated , inter alia , that she was NORP and NORP and had studied psychology at ORG in GPE for DATE , until DATE . Thereafter , in DATE she had joined the human rights association PERSON ( Jeunesse pour la Défense et la Promotion des Droits de l’Homme ) as psychologist in charge at a refugee camp . She also investigated and wrote reports on human rights abuses of which people in the camp had been the victims . In DATE she investigated a massacre in a refugee camp in GPE and found that the FAC ( Forces ORG ) and other political parties had been involved in the massacre . The parties denied any involvement and in DATE the applicant received threats that she would be killed if she did not stop accusing the ORG .
In DATE the applicant ’s home town was attacked . Her father and brother were killed and she was raped by CARDINAL men .

In DATE the applicant finalised a report in which she concluded that a massacre in DATE and DATE of CARDINAL prisoners in GPE had been committed by the intelligence service . As a consequence , its chief PERSON was arrested , also in DATE .
On DATE a group of men came to her home but the applicant and her husband had managed to escape . However , their maid was stabbed to death and her husband ’s daughter was injured .

On DATE , the applicant sought protection at the home of the director of the JDPDH . During the night , the military attacked them . The director and the applicant were threatened that they would be killed unless they changed the report so that PERSON could be released .

In DATE she was arrested by the ORG or by the intelligence service for DATE and ill - treated . Her husband found out where she was and contacted a priest who helped her to obtain travel documents . She was released on CARDINAL DATE and left the country DATE with a smuggler via the airport in GPE .
On DATE ORG ( Migrationsverket ) rejected the application , finding that the applicant had given vague and contradictory information and that she lacked credibility .
On appeal , ORG ( Migrationsdomstolen ) upheld the decision by a judgment of DATE .

On DATE , represented by legal counsel , the applicant appealed against the judgment . On DATE ORG rejected the appeal because it had been lodged out of time . In order to comply with the procedural timelimit the applicant should have appealed before DATE , which was DATE after the disputed judgment .
Thereafter the applicant requested a new assessment by ORG , which was refused on DATE .
On appeal , the decision was upheld by ORG in a judgment of CARDINAL DATE .
The applicant failed to apply for leave to appeal against that judgment to ORG ( Migrationsöverdomstolen ) .
Instead , she reapplied to ORG , which on DATE upheld its decision to refuse to grant the applicant asylum .
On DATE the ORG decided to apply Rule CARDINAL of ORG and to stay the applicant ’s deportation to GPE for the duration of the proceedings before it .
Despite specific requests by the ORG , the applicant has not submitted any domestic decisions taken after DATE .
Relevant domestic law and practice can be found in PERSON v. GPE ( dec . ) , no . CARDINAL , DATE .
Relevant recent information about GPE can be found in PERSON v. GPE , cited above .
